==Events==
* [[326]] &ndash; The [[old St. Peter's Basilica]] is consecrated.
* [[401]] &ndash; The [[Visigoths]], led by king [[Alaric I]], cross the [[Alps]] and invade northern Italy.
*[[1105]] &ndash; Maginulfo is elected the [[Antipope]] as [[Antipope Sylvester IV|Sylvester IV]].
*[[1180]] &ndash; [[Philip II of France|Phillip II]] becomes king of France.
*[[1210]] &ndash; [[Pope Innocent III]] [[Excommunication|excommunicates]] [[Holy Roman Emperor]] [[Otto IV]].
*[[1302]] &ndash; [[Pope Boniface VIII]] issues the [[Papal bull]] ''[[Unam sanctam]]'' (One Faith).
*[[1307]] &ndash; [[William Tell]] shoots an apple off his son's head.
*[[1421]] &ndash; A seawall at the [[Zuiderzee]] dike in the Netherlands breaks, flooding 72 villages and killing about 10,000 people. This event will be known as [[St. Elizabeth's flood (1421)|Sint-Elisabethsvloed]].
*[[1493]] &ndash; [[Christopher Columbus]] first sights the island now known as [[Puerto Rico]].
*[[1494]] &ndash; French King [[Charles VIII of France|Charles VIII]] occupies [[Florence]], Italy.
*[[1601]] &ndash; [[Tiryaki Hasan Pasha]], provincial governor of [[Ottoman Empire]], utterly defeats Habsburg forces, commanded by [[Ferdinand II, Holy Roman Emperor|Ferdinand the Archduke of Austria]] during the [[Siege of Nagykanizsa]].
*[[1626]] &ndash; [[St. Peter's Basilica]] is consecrated.
*[[1686]] &ndash; Charles Francois Felix operates on King [[Louis XIV of France]]'s [[anal fistula]] after practicing the surgery on several peasants.
*[[1730]] &ndash; The future [[Frederick II of Prussia|Frederick II]] (known as Frederick the Great), King of [[Kingdom of Prussia|Prussia]], is granted a royal pardon and released from confinement.
*[[1803]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Vertières]], the last major battle of the [[Haitian Revolution]], is fought, leading to the establishment of the [[Republic of Haiti]], the first black republic in the [[Western Hemisphere]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; In a [[Action of 18 November 1809|naval action]] during the [[Napoleonic Wars]], French [[frigate]]s defeat British [[East Indiamen]] in the [[Bay of Bengal]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: The [[Battle of Krasnoi]] ends in French defeat, but [[Marshal of France]] [[Michel Ney]]'s leadership leads to him becoming known as "the bravest of the brave".
*[[1863]] &ndash; King [[Christian IX of Denmark]] signs the [[History of Schleswig-Holstein#The November Constitution|November constitution]] that declares [[Schleswig]] to be part of Denmark. This is seen by the [[German Confederation]] as a violation of the [[London Protocol (1852)|London Protocol]] and leads to the [[Second War of Schleswig|German–Danish war of 1864]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[Mark Twain]]'s short story ''[[The Celebrated Jumping Frog of Calaveras County]]'' is published in the ''[[The Saturday Press (literary newspaper)|New York Saturday Press]]''.
*[[1883]] &ndash; American and Canadian [[railroad]]s institute five standard continental [[time zone]]s, ending the confusion of thousands of local times.
*[[1903]] &ndash; The [[Hay–Bunau-Varilla Treaty]] is signed by the United States and [[Panama]], giving the United States exclusive rights over the [[Panama Canal Zone]].
*[[1904]] &ndash; General [[Esteban Huertas]] steps down after the government of Panama fears he wants to stage a [[coup]].
*[[1905]] &ndash; Prince Carl of Denmark becomes King [[Haakon VII of Norway]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; Two United States [[warship]]s are sent to [[Nicaragua]] after 500 [[revolutionaries]] (including two Americans) are executed by order of [[José Santos Zelaya]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Battle of the Somme (1916)|First Battle of the Somme]] &ndash; in France, [[British Expeditionary Force (World War I)|British Expeditionary Force]] commander [[Douglas Haig, 1st Earl Haig|Douglas Haig]] calls off the battle which started on July 1, 1916.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Latvia]] declares its independence from Russia.
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[George Bernard Shaw]] refuses to accept the money for his [[Nobel Prize]], saying, "I can forgive [[Alfred Nobel]] for inventing [[dynamite]], but only a fiend in human form could have invented the Nobel Prize."
*[[1928]] &ndash; Release of the animated short ''[[Steamboat Willie]]'', the first fully synchronized sound [[cartoon]], directed by [[Walt Disney]] and [[Ub Iwerks]], featuring the third appearances of cartoon characters [[Mickey Mouse]] and [[Minnie Mouse]]. This is considered by the Disney corporation to be Mickey's birthday.
*[[1929]] &ndash; [[1929 Grand Banks earthquake]]: off the south coast of [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]] in the Atlantic Ocean, a [[Richter magnitude]] 7.2 submarine earthquake, centered on [[Grand Banks]], breaks 12 submarine [[transatlantic telegraph cable]]s and triggers a [[tsunami]] that destroys many south coast communities in the [[Burin Peninsula]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; Soka Kyoiku Gakkai, a Buddhist association later renamed [[Soka Gakkai]], is founded by Japanese educators [[Tsunesaburo Makiguchi]] and [[Josei Toda]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Trade union]] members elect [[John L. Lewis]] as the first president of the [[Congress of Industrial Organizations]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: German leader [[Adolf Hitler]] and Italian Foreign Minister [[Galeazzo Ciano]] meet to discuss [[Benito Mussolini]]'s disastrous invasion of Greece.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[Battle of Berlin (air)|Battle of Berlin]] &ndash; 440 [[Royal Air Force]] planes bomb Berlin causing only light damage and killing 131. The RAF loses nine aircraft and 53 air crew.
*[[1944]] &ndash; The [[Popular Socialist Youth]] is founded in [[Cuba]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[Ballantyne's store disaster|Ballantyne's Department Store fire]] in [[Christchurch]], New Zealand, kills 41; it is the worst fire disaster in the history of New Zealand.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[Iva Valley]] Shooting occurs after the coal miners of [[Enugu]] in [[Nigeria]] go on [[Strike action|strike]] over withheld wages; 21 miners are shot dead and 51 are wounded by police under the supervision of the [[Colonial Nigeria|British colonial administration of Nigeria]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; United States President [[John F. Kennedy]] sends 18,000 military advisors to [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; The first [[push-button telephone]] goes into service.
*[[1970]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Richard Nixon]] asks the [[Congress of the United States|U.S. Congress]] for $155 million in supplemental aid for the [[Cambodia]]n government.
*[[1978]] &ndash; In [[Jonestown]], [[Guyana]], [[Jim Jones]] led his [[Peoples Temple]] cult to a mass [[murder-suicide]] that claimed 918 lives in all, 909 of them in Jonestown itself, including over 270 children. [[Leo Ryan|Congressman Leo J. Ryan]] is murdered by members of the Peoples Temple hours earlier.
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[King's Cross fire]]: In London, 31 people die in a fire at the city's busiest [[London Underground|underground]] station, [[King's Cross St. Pancras tube station|King's Cross St Pancras]].
*[[1988]] &ndash; [[War on Drugs]]: U.S. President [[Ronald Reagan]] signs a bill into law allowing the [[Capital punishment|death penalty]] for [[drug trafficking|drug traffickers]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Shiite]] [[Muslim]] kidnappers in [[Lebanon]] release [[Anglican Communion|Anglican Church]] envoys [[Terry Waite]] and [[Thomas Sutherland (academic)|Thomas Sutherland]].
*  1991   &ndash; After an 87-day [[Battle of Vukovar|siege]], the [[Croatia]]n city of [[Vukovar]] capitulates to the besieging Yugoslav People's Army and allied Serb paramilitary forces.
*[[1993]] &ndash; In the United States, the [[North American Free Trade Agreement]] (NAFTA) is approved by the [[United States House of Representatives|House of Representatives]].
*  1993   &ndash; In South Africa, 21 political parties approve a new [[Constitution of South Africa|constitution]], expanding voting rights and ending white minority rule.
*[[1999]] &ndash; In [[College Station, Texas]], 12 are killed and 27 injured at [[Texas A&M University]] when the {{convert|59|ft|m|adj=mid|-tall}} [[Aggie Bonfire]], under construction for the [[Texas–Texas A&M football rivalry|rivalry football game]] between the [[Texas A&M Aggies football|Texas A&M Aggies]] and [[Texas Longhorns football|Texas Longhorns]], collapses at 2:42am.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Iraq disarmament crisis]]: [[United Nations]] weapons inspectors led by [[Hans Blix]] arrive in [[Iraq]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; In the United Kingdom, the [[Local Government Act 2003]], repealing controversial anti-gay amendment [[Section 28]], becomes effective.
*  2003   &ndash; The [[Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court]] rules 4 to 3 in ''[[Goodridge v. Department of Public Health]]'' that the state's ban on same-sex marriage is unconstitutional and gives the state legislature 180 days to change the law making Massachusetts the first state in the United States to grant marriage rights to same-sex couples.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Nintendo]] releases the [[Wii U]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[NASA]] launches the [[MAVEN]] probe to [[Mars]].
